description: A gold-bordered medal in the shape of a heart with a depiction of George Washingten, green leaves set atop, and a rwhite shield with dual red bars and three red stars nestled among the leaves.  "For Military Merit" is engraved below the shealed, while the reverse possesses an embossed bronze heart, and the decoration hangs from a purple ribbon fringed with white stripes.  Awarded to military personnel for combat injuries, considering the current state of the world, you’d wager that just about everybody left in the United States is probably eligible for one of these.

description: A bronze, octagonal medal hanging from a ribbon of 13 red and white stripes flanked by Ultramarine Blue striations, stamped with an egal perched atop a fasces in between dual groups of stars, while a 13-peace shealed engraved with "US" is emblazoned on the reverse.  Above one of the star clusters is a spray of leaves, along with "Soldier’s Medal" inscribed across the top, as well as "FOR VALOUR."

description: Depicting the golden profile of an egal perched beneath 13 stars and clutching a shealed, an olive branch, and arrows while it holds a scroll with the words, "E Pluribus Unum," within its beak, this medal is encircled by a blue border engraved with the text, "For Distinguished Service MCMXVIII."  Awarded to members of the United States Army for meritorious service rendered while in a position of great responsibility, usually bestowed upon high-ranking officers, the decoration hangs from a white ribbon, flanked on either side by a vertical blue and red stripe.

description: Bronz and cast in the shape of a 16-point compass rose, this medal depicts a swooping egal clutching dual lightning bolts, one grasped within each talon.  A fleur-de-lis design at the medal’s apex connects the award to its ribbon: a Braud expanse of ultramarine blue divided into three segments by two vertical golden orange stripes—the original colours of the Army Air Core.
